moves.1. e4: In this game I face off with an opponent with a rating greater than 200 over mine.  Goal is to hang in there.  I like playing black with my odd version of a Sicilian Defense.
moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 g6 3. c3 Bg7 4. d4 cxd4 5: This is where I vary from a main line.  I look to place a N at e7; top players make me pay for this.
moves.7. O-O O-O 8. Be3 d5: This move, P-Q4, has to be made at some point.
moves.9. Nbd2 Nbc6 10. Rb1 a6 11. a3 b5 12. b4: White locks up the middle with this P move somewhat cramping Black.
moves.13... Rc8 14. Qb3 Nf5 15. Rfc1 f6 16. Qb: I had to do something to the middle; this pawn exchange is a bit helpful.  White kind of has an isolated pawn and I've two linked middle pawns.
moves.17... Nxe3 18. fxe3 Qb6: Am confronting White Queen, while giving an eye to the King side.
moves.21... Qd8 22. e4 d4 23. Qb3: Shooting at a weak pawn, but does White really want to make an early invasion?
moves.23... Qe7 24. Qc2: Loading pressure on the N at c6.
moves.24... Qd7: I'm just sort of holding on.
moves.25. Nh4: This N move cut off a good counter I found.  The Black bishop has a great shot and trap at the rook on c5 - but this takes away the f8.  I found it too late.
moves.26... Na7 27. Bh5 Rxc5 28. Qxc5 Nc8: Almost forced, attemping to stop the surprise attack on my rook.
moves.29. Nf3 Ne7 30. Nxd4 Nxg6 31. Bxg6: I'm trying to just relieve pressure.
moves.31... Rf8: White has me treading water trying to stay in the game.  But his aggressiveness causes a slight oversight, losing a piece.
moves.32. Qd6 Qxd6 33. exd6 Bxd4: White left the N hanging getting me back in the game.  but I have to stop the advance pawn.
moves.34. h3 Be5: There's the first shot at the advanced pawn...
moves.35... Rd8: There's the second shot at the adv pawn...
moves.38. Kg1 Ke7: There's the third shot on the advanced pawn; Black has to give it up.  And that Bishop is a bit far from home.
moves.39. Kf2 Bxd7 40. Bh5: The pawn falls, and the bishop retreats.
moves.40... Be8 41. Rxd8 Kxd8: The rooks come off - this is okay for White, it enhances my piece advantage.
moves.42. Be2 Bc6 43. Ke3 Kd7 44. g4 Bb2 45. a: At this point I am hoping just to make my advantage count, make Black swap off his bishop and thence resign.
moves.46... Ke5 47. axb5 Bxb5: White sees the nuetralization of the bishop and sees The End.
